name: Nutrition Tracker & Meal Logger with Telegram, Gemini AI and Google Sheets

user.name: John Alejandro SIlva
user.bio: Detail-oriented professional with a dual degree in Systems Engineering and Business Administration and international experience in technology and process improvement. I specialize in workflow automation with n8n, API integration, programming, and data analysis. Known for strong analytical skills and clear technical documentation.

description:
# 🤖🥗 Telegram Nutrition AI Assistant (Alternative to Cal AI App)

> AI-powered nutrition assistant for Telegram — log meals, set goals, and get personalized daily reports with Google Sheets integration.

## 📋 Description

This n8n template creates a **Telegram-based Nutrition AI Assistant** 🥑🔥 designed as an **open-source alternative to the Cal AI mobile app**.
It allows users to interact with an AI agent via text, voice, or images to track meals, calculate macros, and monitor nutrition goals directly from Telegram.

The system integrates **Google Sheets** as the database, handling both user profiles and meal logs, while leveraging **Gemini AI** for natural conversation, food recognition, and daily progress reports.

## ✨ Key Features

* 💬 **Multi-input support**: Text, voice messages (transcribed), and food images (AI analysis).
* 📊 **Macro calculation**: Automatic estimation of calories, proteins, carbs, and fats.
* 📝 **User-friendly registration**: Simple onboarding without storing personal health data (no weight/height required).
* 🎯 **Goal tracking**: Users can set and update calorie and protein targets.
* 📈 **Daily reports**: Personalized progress messages with visual progress bars.
* 🗂 **Google Sheets integration**:

  * `Profile` table for user targets.
  * `Meals` table for food logs.
* 🔄 **Advanced n8n nodes**: Includes use of `Merge`, `Subworkflow`, and `Code` nodes for data processing and report generation.

## 💡 Acknowledgment

Inspired by the Cal AI concept 💡 — this template demonstrates how to reproduce its main functionality with **n8n, Telegram, and AI agents** as a flexible, open-source automation workflow.

## 🏷 Tags

* `telegram`
* `ai-assistant`
* `nutrition`
* `meal-tracking`
* `google-sheets`
* `food-logging`
* `voice-transcription`
* `image-analysis`
* `daily-reports`
* `n8n-template`
* `merge-node`
* `subworkflow-node`
* `code-node`
* `telegram-trigger`
* `google-gemini`

## 💼 Use Case

Use this template if you want to:

* 🥗 Log meals using **text, images, or voice messages**.
* 📊 Track nutrition goals (calories, proteins) with daily progress updates.
* 🤖 Provide a **chat-based nutrition assistant** without building a full app.
* 🗂 Store structured nutrition data in **Google Sheets** for easy access and analysis.

## 💬 Example User Interactions

* 📸 User sends a photo of a meal → AI analyzes the food and logs calories/macros.
* 🎤 User sends a voice message → AI transcribes and logs the meal.
* ⌨️ User types “report” → AI returns a daily nutrition summary with progress bars.
* 🥅 User says “update my protein goal” → AI updates profile in Google Sheets.

## 🔑 Required Credentials

* Telegram Bot API (Bot Token)
* Google Sheets API credentials
* AI Provider API (Google Gemini or compatible LLM)

## ⚙️ Setup Instructions

1. 🗂 Create two Google Sheets tables:

   * **Profile**: `User_ID, Name, Calories_target, Protein_target`
   * **Meals**: `User_ID, Date, Meal_description, Calories, Proteins, Carbs, Fats`
2. 🔌 Configure the Telegram Trigger with your bot token.
3. 🤖 Connect your AI provider credentials (Gemini recommended).
4. 📑 Connect Google Sheets with your credentials.
5. ▶️ Deploy the workflow in n8n.
6. 🎯 Start interacting with your nutrition assistant via Telegram.

## 📌 Extra Notes

* 🟩 **Green section**: Handles Telegram trigger and user check.
* 🟥 **Red section**: Registers new users and sets goals.
* 🟦 **Blue section**: Processes text, voice, and images.
* 🟨 **Yellow section**: Generates nutrition reports.
* 🟪 **Purple section**: Main AI agent controlling tools and logic.

---

## 💡 Need Assistance?

If you’d like help customizing or extending this workflow, feel free to reach out:  

📧 Email: [johnsilva11031@gmail.com](mailto:johnsilva11031@gmail.com)  
🔗 LinkedIn: [John Alejandro Silva Rodríguez](https://www.linkedin.com/in/john-alejandro-silva-rodriguez-48093526b/)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

parameters.text:
=You are a Nutrition Vision Assistant. Think like a food scientist and registered dietitian. Reason silently and do not reveal your steps. From a single food photo, identify the meal components, estimate portion weight in grams per component using geometric/visual cues, then compute total calories, protein, carbs, and fat.

Estimation method (internal only; do not output these steps)

Identify components: list the main foods (e.g., chicken breast, white rice, mixed salad, sauce).

Choose references: map each component to a standard reference food.

Estimate volume/size: use visible objects for scale (plate ≈ 27 cm diameter, fork tines ≈ 3.5 cm, spoon bowl ≈ 5–6 cm). Approximate shapes (cuboid, cylinder, dome) to get volume in ml (≈ cm³).

Convert to grams (densities, g/ml): meats 1.05; cooked rice 0.66; cooked pasta 0.60; potato/solid starchy veg 0.80; leafy salad 0.15; sauces creamy 1.00; oils 0.91. If the image clearly suggests deep-fried or glossy/oily coating, account for added oil.

Macros & energy per 100 g (reference values):

White rice, cooked: 130 kcal, P 2.7, C 28, F 0.3

Pasta, cooked: 131 kcal, P 5.0, C 25, F 1.1

Chicken breast, cooked skinless: 165 kcal, P 31, C 0, F 3.6

Salmon, cooked: 208 kcal, P 20, C 0, F 13

Lean ground beef (≈10% fat), cooked: 217 kcal, P 26, C 0, F 12

Black beans, cooked: 132 kcal, P 8.9, C 23.7, F 0.5

Potato, baked: 93 kcal, P 2.5, C 21, F 0.1

Lettuce/leafy salad: 15 kcal, P 1.4, C 2.9, F 0.2

Avocado: 160 kcal, P 2, C 9, F 15

Bread (white): 265 kcal, P 9, C 49, F 3.2

Egg, cooked: 155 kcal, P 13, C 1.1, F 11

Cheddar cheese: 403 kcal, P 25, C 1.3, F 33

Olive oil: 884 kcal, P 0, C 0, F 100
(If a food is not listed, pick the closest standard equivalent.)

Hidden oil & sauces: if pan-fried or visibly glossy, add ~1 tablespoon oil = 13.5 g = 120 kcal = 13.5 g fat per clearly coated serving; adjust by visual coverage.

Sum totals: compute grams per component × (per-100 g macros/energy) and add all components.

Validation: enforce Calories ≈ 4×Protein + 4×Carbs + 9×Fat. If off by >8%, adjust fat first (oil/sauce most variable), then carbs (starches), keeping protein consistent with visible lean mass.

Rounding: round all final totals to integers. Never output ranges or decimals.

Output rules (must follow exactly)

Plain text only.

Use this exact structure and field order.

Values are numbers only (no units, no “g” or “kcal”), no extra text, no JSON, no notes.

Meal Description: [short description]
Calories: [number]
Proteins: [number]
Carbs: [number]
Fat: [number]
What's in this audio message from telegram user?

options.systemMessage:
=You are Cal AI 🏋️‍♂️🥦, the friendly fitness & nutrition coach assistant.
Your single job is to register a new user into the Users table while keeping the tone supportive, clear, and motivational. Always use emojis related to health, training, and food (🔥💪🥦🍗🌾🥑).

🔑 Registration Rules

You MUST collect these fields:

user_id (not asked, system provides it)

name

calories_target

protein_target

📌 When sending data to the Register User tool, always send numbers only (no units, no text, no emojis) for calories_target and protein_targe

If the user does not know their numeric targets, do not invent them. Instead, coach them by politely asking for:

weight ⚖️

height 📏

age 🎂

goal 🎯 (gain muscle 💪, lose fat 🔥, maintain ⚖️)

Based on this info, calculate precise calorie and protein targets.

Only when all fields are collected and confirmed → call Register User tool with the final data.

✅ After Successful Registration

Send a short, friendly confirmation like a coach:

“Awesome, champ 💪! Your nutrition targets are locked in: 🔥 [calories] kcal, 🍗 [protein] g protein.”

Then, explain clearly how to use Cal AI:

📸 Send food photos → get instant calories + macros.

⚙️ View or update your targets anytime.

📑 Request daily reports → compare intake vs. targets with charts.

🗣️ Style Guide

Always keep responses simple, clear, and concise.

Speak like a friendly trainer/coach who motivates the user.

Use emojis to highlight key concepts.

Be warm, supportive, and practical:

“Let’s get you set up for success 🏋️‍♂️🔥”

“Strong start, [Name]! Targets ready 💪🥦.”

=You are Cal AI 🏋️‍♂️🥦, your friendly fitness coach and nutrition orchestrator.
Your mission is to guide the user with motivation, clarity, and precision while managing their nutrition data. Speak in a supportive, energetic tone like a personal trainer, and use relevant emojis (🔥💪🥦🍗🌾🥑) to keep the conversation fun and engaging.

You have four tools available:

appendMealData(tool) → store a meal row in Meals sheet.

updateProfileData(tool) → update the user's profile targets (fields: Name, Calories_target, Protein_target).

getUserData(tool) → fetch the user's profile info.

getReport(tool) → generate or fetch the daily report (requires date).

🔑 Rules

The image analysis is done before reaching you. You will always receive structured info:
Meal Description: [short description]
Calories: [number]
Proteins: [number]
Carbs: [number]
Fat: [number]

With this info, call appendMealData.

After appendMealData success, confirm naturally in a coach style: repeat the meal info using emojis (🔥 Calories, 🍗 Protein, 🌾 Carbs, 🥑 Fat).

End confirmations with a quick motivational phrase like:

“Great fuel for your body 💪🔥”

“Another step closer to your goals 🥦🏋️‍♂️”

Always offer short next-step options:
👉 “View daily report 📑”
👉 “Analyze another meal 📸”
👉 “View or update profile targets ⚙️”

🔄 Profile Update Logic

When the user wants to update their profile (Name, Calories_target, or Protein_target):

First call getUserData to fetch current profile info.

Compare the requested update with the existing values.

Only pass the changed fields to updateProfileData (never overwrite unchanged values).

Confirm to the user in a friendly way, e.g.:

“✅ Your Calories_target is now 2200 🔥. Protein_target stays strong at 150 🍗.”

“Profile updated! Let’s crush it 💪🥦.”

📑 Tool Usage Rules

getUserData → always called first before updating the profile.

updateProfileData → only include the fields that have changed.

getReport → only pass the requested date.

Keep all responses short, clear, motivational, and full of energy.

📅 Date: {{ $today.format('yyyy-MM-dd') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
=updateProfileData
Purpose: Update the user’s profile targets.
Fields that can be updated:

Name (string)

Calories_target (string/number)

Protein_target (string/number)
When to use: When the user explicitly asks to update their name, calorie target, or protein target.

=getUserData
Purpose: Retrieve the user’s profile information.
Inputs: none.
When to use: When the user asks about their profile info or targets.

parameters.description:
getReport
Purpose: Generate or fetch the user’s daily nutrition report.
Input required: date (string, format: YYYY-MM-DD).
When to use: When the user asks to see their daily summary or report for a specific date.

parameters.toolDescription:
appendMealData
Purpose: Store one meal entry into the Meals sheet.
Inputs required:

Meal Description (string)

Calories (number)

Proteins (number)

Carbs (number)

Fat (number)
When to use: Every time you receive structured meal information from image analysis.

parameters.content:
# 📘 Cal AI Alternative – Nutrition Assistant 

This workflow implements a **Nutrition Assistant** that helps users log meals, track nutritional goals, and receive personalized reports.  
The system integrates **Telegram**, **Google Sheets**, and an **AI Agent (Gemini)** within **n8n**.

✅ **With this workflow, users can:**  
- Register easily via Telegram.  
- Log meals with text, voice, or images.  
- Track nutrition goals automatically.  
- Receive daily personalized reports.

## Telegram Trigger & User Check

**Purpose:** Handle incoming messages and validate user registration.

1. **Telegram Trigger**  
   - Captures user messages (text, voice, or images) from Telegram.

2. **User Registration Check**  
   - Verifies if the sender exists in the `Profile` table (Google Sheets).
   - If the user **is not registered** → Redirects to **Zone Red (Register Agent)**.  
   - If the user **is registered** → Forwards the message to **Zone Blue (Message Processing)**.

## Register Agent

**Purpose:** Register new users and set up nutritional goals.

1. **Register Agent**  
   - Guides new users through the registration process.  
   - Collects user details:
     - **Name**
     - **Calories_target**
     - **Protein_target**

2. **Target Assistance**  
   - If the user is unsure about their targets, the agent asks simple questions to help determine suitable daily calorie and protein goals.  
   - ⚠️ **Note:** No personal health data (e.g., weight, height) is stored.

3. **Database Update**  
   - Once confirmed, the new profile is added to the **Profile Table** in Google Sheets.  
   - The user is now considered "registered" and future messages will be processed in **Zone Blue**.

## Message Processing

**Purpose:** Classify and process different types of user messages.

1. **Message Routing**  
   - Determines the type of message received:
     - **Text** → Sent directly to the AI Agent.  
     - **Voice/Audio** → Downloaded, transcribed, and converted into text.  
     - **Image** → Downloaded and analyzed by Google AI Vision.

2. **Image Analysis (Food Recognition)**  
   - Google AI receives a custom prompt to analyze food images.  
   - The AI:
     - Identifies food items.  
     - Estimates nutritional values (Calories, Proteins, Carbs, Fats).  
     - Returns the analysis in a structured, human-readable text format.  

3. **Error Handling**  
   - If processing fails, a fallback node (`get_error_message`) sends an error notification to the user.

## Report Subworkflow

**Purpose:** Generate personalized daily nutrition reports.

1. **Get Meals & Targets**  
   - Retrieves all logged meals for the selected day from the database.  
   - Fetches the user’s nutrition targets from the profile.

2. **Progress Calculation**  
   - Runs a code node to calculate:
     - Daily totals (Calories, Proteins, etc.)  
     - Percentage progress toward targets.

3. **Report Formatting**  
   - Returns a **personalized message** with:
     - Summary of meals logged.  
     - Totals and percentages.  
     - A **progress bar** visualization of calories and proteins.

##  Main AI Agent

**Purpose:** Central decision-making agent for all user interactions.

The AI Agent (Gemini) operates with **four key tools**:

1. **getProfileData**  
   - Retrieves user profile (calorie/protein targets).

2. **updateProfileData**  
   - Updates user goals upon request.

3. **appendMealData**  
   - Adds new meal entries to the **Meals Table** in Google Sheets.

4. **getReport**  
   - Triggers **Zone Yellow** to generate a daily progress report.

**Conversation Flow:**  
- Managed with the **Simple Memory node**, ensuring contextual and natural dialogue.  
- All responses are returned to the user via Telegram.

## 💡 Need Assistance?

If you’d like help customizing or extending this workflow, feel free to reach out:  

📧 Email: [johnsilva11031@gmail.com](mailto:johnsilva11031@gmail.com)  
🔗 LinkedIn: [John Alejandro Silva Rodríguez](https://www.linkedin.com/in/john-alejandro-silva-rodriguez-48093526b/)

# **Documentation: Configuring the Telegram Nutrition AI Assistant Workflow**

This guide provides step-by-step instructions for setting up the Google Sheets database and configuring the required n8n nodes to make the workflow fully operational.

---

### **Important Notes on Errors and Customization**

*   **Public Sheet Errors:** If you encounter persistent errors while using the pre-configured public Google Sheet, it is highly probable that another user has modified its structure (e.g., deleted or renamed a column header), causing the workflow to fail. The most reliable way to resolve this is to follow the instructions in **Step 1** to set up and connect your own private Google Sheet.

*   **Connection Issues:** Please be aware that intermittent connection errors with Google services can occasionally occur. If a Google (Sheets or Gemini) node fails, simply re-executing the step or the entire workflow is often enough to resolve the issue.

*   **Customizing the AI Model:** While this workflow is pre-configured with Google Gemini for all AI-driven tasks, n8n's modular design allows for easy customization. You can swap the Gemini nodes for any large language model (LLM) you prefer, such as those from OpenAI, Anthropic, or others, to better suit your specific needs or existing subscriptions.

---

## **Step 1: Setting Up Your Google Sheets**

You will need a Google Sheet with two specific tabs ("Sheets") to act as your database.

1.  **Create a Copy of the Template**
    The easiest way to start is by making a copy of the official template. Open the link below and go to `File > Make a copy`.
    *   **Template Link:** [Google Sheets Nutrition Template](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/11kI8q0oB2vPzbVJOItdna5o0y7szuoprJSA8v0Bt-Ec/edit?usp=sharing)

2.  **Verify Sheet Structure**
    Ensure your copy has the following two tabs with the exact column headers:

    *   **Sheet 1: `Profile`**
        This sheet stores user information and their nutritional goals.
        *   `User_ID`
        *   `Name`
        *   `Calories_target`
        *   `Protein_target`

    *   **Sheet 2: `Meals`**
        This sheet logs every meal entry for all users.
        *   `User_ID`
        *   `Date`
        *   `Meal_description`
        *   `Calories`
        *   `Proteins`
        *   `Carbs`
        *   `Fats`

3.  **Get Your Spreadsheet ID**
    Copy the ID from your new spreadsheet's URL. It is the long string of characters between `/d/` and `/edit`.
    `https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/`**`[YOUR_SPREADSHEET_ID]`**`/edit`

---

## **Step 2: Configuring the n8n Google Sheets Nodes**

>Now it's time to connect the workflow to your new Google Sheet. The following documentation is organized to match the colored sections you see on the n8n canvas. Each part of this guide details the specific configuration for the Google Sheets nodes located within its corresponding colored section.

---

By following these steps, you will have successfully reconfigured the workflow to use your own private and secure Google Sheet, ensuring its long-term stability and the privacy of your data.

#### **🟩 Green Section: Telegram Trigger & User Check**

This section checks if a user is already registered.

**Node: `Registered?`**
*   **Purpose:** Looks for the user's `chat.id` in the `Profile` sheet to see if they exist.
*   **Configuration:**
    1.  **Credential to connect with:** Select your Google Sheets account credential.
    2.  **Operation:** `Get Row(s)`.
    3.  **Document:** Select your Google Sheet document ("Cal AI" in the example).
    4.  **Sheet:** Select `Profile`.
    5.  **Filters > Column:** `User_ID`.
    6.  **Filters > Value:** Set this to the following expression to get the chat ID from the Telegram trigger: `{{ $('Telegram Trigger').item.json.message.chat.id }}`.
![](https://github.com/JarsRat/Images/blob/main/Documentation/Screenshot%202025-08-28%20070009.png?raw=true)

#### **🟥 Red Section: Register Agent**

This section handles the creation of a new user profile.

**Node: `Register User`**
*   **Purpose:** Adds a new row with the new user's information to the `Profile` sheet after they complete the registration dialogue.
*   **Configuration:**
    1.  **Credential to connect with:** Select your Google Sheets account credential.
    2.  **Operation:** `Append Row`.
    3.  **Document:** Select your Google Sheet.
    4.  **Sheet:** Select `Profile`.
    5.  **Mapping Column Mode:** `Map Each Column Manually`.
    6.  **Values to Send:**
        *   **User\_ID:** Set this to the expression that holds the user's chat ID, for example: `{{ $json.chat_id }}`.
        *   **Name, Calories\_target, Protein\_target:** These fields will be populated dynamically by the AI model (`Register Agent`) that runs just before this node. You don't need to enter a static value here; the workflow will automatically pass the extracted information.
![](https://github.com/JarsRat/Images/blob/main/Documentation/Screenshot%202025-08-28%20070403.png?raw=true)

#### **🟪 Purple Section: Main AI Agent**

This is the core section that handles user interactions, including retrieving data, logging meals, and updating profiles.

**Node: `Get Profile Data`**
*   **Purpose:** Retrieves the user's profile (including their goals) from the `Profile` sheet. This provides the AI Agent with the necessary context for the conversation.
*   **Configuration:**
    1.  **Credential to connect with:** Select your Google Sheets account credential.
    2.  **Operation:** `Get Row(s)`.
    3.  **Document:** Select your Google Sheet.
    4.  **Sheet:** Select `Profile`.
    5.  **Filters > Column:** `User_ID`.
    6.  **Filters > Value:** Use an expression to reference the user's chat ID from the input, for example: `{{ $json.chat_id }}`.

![](https://github.com/JarsRat/Images/blob/main/Documentation/Screenshot%202025-08-28%20070500.png?raw=true)

**Node: `Append Meal Data`**
*   **Purpose:** Logs a new meal into the `Meals` sheet after the AI has analyzed the user's text, voice, or image input.
*   **Configuration:**
    1.  **Credential to connect with:** Select your Google Sheets account credential.
    2.  **Operation:** `Append Row`.
    3.  **Document:** Select your Google Sheet.
    4.  **Sheet:** Select `Meals`.
    5.  **Values to Send:**
        *   **User\_ID:** `{{ $json.chat_id }}`.
        *   **Date:** `{{ $today.format("YYYY-LL-DD") }}` (This sets the current date for the meal entry).
        *   **Meal\_description, Calories, Proteins, Carbs, Fats:** These fields are populated dynamically by the AI model. The workflow will pass the extracted nutritional data to this node.

![](https://github.com/JarsRat/Images/blob/main/Documentation/Screenshot%202025-08-28%20070542.png?raw=true)

**Node: `Update Profile Data`**
*   **Purpose:** Modifies an existing user's record in the `Profile` sheet, typically used when a user asks to change their calorie or protein goals.
*   **Configuration:**
    1.  **Credential to connect with:** Select your Google Sheets account credential.
    2.  **Operation:** `Update Row`.
    3.  **Document:** Select your Google Sheet.
    4.  **Sheet:** Select `Profile`.
    5.  **Column to match on:** `User_ID`. This tells the node which column to use to find the correct row to update.
    6.  **Values to Send:**
        *   **User\_ID (using to match):** `{{ $json.chat_id }}`. This value is used to find the right row.
        *   **Name, Calories\_target, Protein\_target:** These are the fields to be updated. The AI Agent will provide the new values, which the workflow will pass into these fields.

![](https://github.com/JarsRat/Images/blob/main/Documentation/Screenshot%202025-08-28%20070601.png?raw=truee)

#### **🟨 Yellow Section: Report Subworkflow**

This subworkflow is triggered to generate and send a daily nutrition report to the user.

**Node: `Get Meals Info`**
*   **Purpose:** Fetches all meals logged by a specific user for the current day from the `Meals` sheet.
*   **Configuration:**
    1.  **Credential to connect with:** Select your Google Sheets account credential.
    2.  **Operation:** `Get Row(s)`.
    3.  **Document:** Select your Google Sheet.
    4.  **Sheet:** Select `Meals`.
    5.  **Filters:**
        *   **Filter 1:**
            *   **Column:** `Date`.
            *   **Value:** `{{ $json.Date }}` (or the expression representing the current date from the input).
        *   **Filter 2 (Recommended):**
            *   Click **Add Filter**.
            *   **Combine Filters:** `AND`.
            *   **Column:** `User_ID`.
            *   **Value:** `{{ $json.User_ID }}` (or the expression for the user's ID from the input). This is critical to ensure you only get meals for the correct user.

![](https://github.com/JarsRat/Images/blob/main/Documentation/Screenshot%202025-08-28%20070616.png?raw=true)



---

**Node: `Get User Info`**
*   **Purpose:** Retrieves the user's goals from the `Profile` sheet to calculate their progress in the daily report.
*   **Configuration:**
    1.  **Credential to connect with:** Select your Google Sheets account credential.
    2.  **Operation:** `Get Row(s)`.
    3.  **Document:** Select your Google Sheet.
    4.  **Sheet:** Select `Profile`.
    5.  **Filters > Add Filter:**
        *   **Column:** `User_ID`.
        *   **Value:** Use an expression that references the User ID passed into the subworkflow, for example: `{{ $json.User_ID }}`.

![](https://github.com/JarsRat/Images/blob/main/Documentation/Correction.png?raw=true)
